column1: full and in the corridor, gets forward and pushes it off the middle of the bat into the covers
good length, outside off, tapped on the up to cover point
good ball. Nips back in from just outside off and catches the inside edge onto his thigh as he prods forward
back of a length at off stump, stands tall and opens the face to run it down to third man
good length at off stump, walks into the forward defence

gone! Sandeep rewarded for his consistency. This is back of a length in the corridor. He puts half a foot forward but is mostly static as he pushes away from the body to try and run it to third man. Gets a thin outside edge that is no trouble for Saha. No demonstrable movement there, just a good line and length. It's enough
back of a length at off stump, defends off the back foot to mid-on
back of a length at off stump, pushes into the off side on the up
back of a length at off stump, drives on the up, straight to extra cover
yorker, angled across off stump and going away. Tries to squeeze this down to third man, beaten
bouncer at middle stump, climbs sharply at Samson, but short enough for him to sway away from it
walks at the bowler, doesn't have to do much in the end, because this is down the leg side at waist height
back of a length, angling across the batsman, bat turns as he drives on the up to cover point
thick outside edge as he goes hard at this drive outside off stump. It wasn't full enough, straightened after pitching. Third man cleans up to his left
bouncer sits in the pitch and Samson is through the shot early, it slides through to the keeper outside off stump
finally hits one in the gap. This isn't off the middle, but the timing, as always, is there. Good length outside off, stands tall and punches it wide of mid-off with a closed bat face
good length at off stump, flicks it to short midwicket

it was coming. Samson didn't look comfortable on this pitch after the first few deliveries. The ball has been biting into the pitch and it does so again. Straightens off a length at middle stump. He looks to whip this over midwicket but the deviation means it gets the toe of the bat and balloons up to mid-off
full outside off stump, driven away from the body, straight to cover point
good length at off stump, gets behind the line and defends it back down the pitch
slower ball, good length, wide outside off stump. Can't time this as he slashes on the up, a couple of bounces through to cover point
glorious.This is overpitched outside off and he leans into it, gets close with a shortish stride, and uses his wrists to get this cover drive past extra cover
back of a length at off stump, rides the bounce and dabs it to third man
back of a length outside off, cuts it on the bounce to backward point
good length at middle stump, pushes on the up to deep square
back of a length outside off, pulls across the line but is through the shot early. Drags it off the inside edge to deep square
full at off stump, defended with an open face into the off side
good length at off stump, slight shape away but he's behind it nicely as he pushes off the front foot to mid-off
shot. This is short and just outside off stump. Bounces up slowly but he's adjusted nicely and pulled this in front of square and over the boundary line. No half measures.
good length at middle stump, pushed on the up to mid-on

good length outside off stump, he looks to drive on the up but it's the two-paced nature once more. This stops on him and takes the toe of the bat and floats teasingly in front of Sandeep who stays low in his follow-through and dives low to his left with one hand that is perfectly under the ball as he takes it
good length at off stump, defended off the front foot into the covers
back of a length outside off stump, pokes at it on the up, bat turns and it rolls to mid-on
good length, at off stump, solidly behind it and defended down the pitch
good length outside off stump, leans in, opens the face and taps it wide of third man
slower ball, full at off stump, driven straight to extra cover
good length at off stump, defended into the off side off the front foot

gone first ball! This is a good length ball at off stump. No real drift, no real spin, no real flight, but it's a good line and length. Nair is looking to push this through the covers on the up and ends up playing inside the line. Loses his off stump
full outside off stump, thick outside edge to short third man as he looks to drive
short and wide outside off, cuts it to short third man's left
back of a length at off stump, hangs deep in the crease and turns this with a flat bat to deep square
back of a length, flat outside off, too late on the back foot punch. Toe-ends it to point
good length, flat and fired down leg side
arm ball, good length, wide outside off. Punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
good length, drifted in at off stump, goes straight through. Inside half on the forward defence
good length at off stump, driven on the up to extra cover
good length at middle stump, waits for it and pushes late into the midwicket region

goes through his defence! This is good length at off, and it slides through with the arm. Pant's bat is angled - it's coming down from the third man direction. And it has come down late. Flicks his front pad which isn't fully forward and that's half the side down
tossed up at middle stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
full at middle stump, flicks it to long-on
oh nearly sneaks through. Arm ball, good length at middle stump. He puts a stride across and nearly locks himself out, but gets the bat down in time
full at leg stump, pushed to long-on off the front foot
good length at middle stump, hangs deep in the crease and whips it to deep square

advance your dinner plans to catch the next game, this won't be long. Good length at off stump. He's on the back foot and tries to punch this to long-on. Once again, not the shot to play on this pitch. Another one sits in the pitch, another one chips back to the bowler, and this time a dive isn't even needed
oh nearly gets another. Arm ball just outside off, Rabada doesn't believe in feet as he pokes at this. Beaten on the outside edge
good length at off stump, no feet again but he gets bat on this and pushes it down the pitch
good length, angles in and catches him on the pads as he looks to turn this into the leg side. Not out, sliding down
back of a length at off stump, sliding in again, just about squeezes it out off the back foot, into the off side
tossed up at off stump, driven to long-off
good length at middle stump, pushes forward, gets it off the inside half of the bat into the leg side
good length at middle stump, forward defence back to the bowler
drifted full at leg stump, steps out and flicks it to deep square's right
full at off stump, closes the face too early as he looks to flick, leading edge is back to the bowler
back of a length at off stump, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
good length at off stump, leans in and pushes it past the bowler to long-off
back of a length at middle stump, goes deep and waits for the ball, then punches to long-on
good length outside off, stays in the crease and pokes away from the body, behind square on the off side
that's how you play on a slow pitch. Gives him the charge, meets the good length ball at the pitch, picks it up from off stump and sends it flying over the midwicket boundary
good length at middle stump, pushed down the pitch off the front foot
goes on the back foot, rapped on the pads, but outside leg stump
full ball outside off stump, gets a nice stride forward and drives it to long-off's right
good length at off stump, pushes on the up, gets it past extra cover's dive. Long-off cleans up
back of a length outside off, waits for it to turn and slaps it flat-batted to sweeper's left
good length, angling in at leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
good length, fired down leg side and past the  attempted glance
good length at middle stump, looks to push it to long-on off the back foot, midwicket comes across to his right and cuts it off
back of a length, flat, wide outside off, slides past his cut shot
full at middle stump, driven down to long-on
good length at leg stump, pushed to deep midwicket off the front foot
back of a length at off stump, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
good length at middle stump, gives him the charge and uses his pace to lift his over the non-striker and wide of long-on
back of a length at off stump, punched off the back foot to extra cover

was that dropped? Sounded like it was. Back of a length outside off stump, climbs on him as he looks to dab it past short third. Saha can't gather it. Replays are inconclusive, but that sounded like an edge
back of a length at off stump, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
good length, fired in flat at off stump, gets an inside edge as he pokes at this away from the body, it trickles past leg stump
back of a length at middle stump, punched off the back foot to long-on
good length at off stump, defended into the off side off the front foot
gets the breakthrough! Bowls this nice and full outside off, Anderson's feet are rooted as he looks to drive this through extra cover. Too far away from the body. Inside edge thuds into the stumps
bouncer outside off stump, gets on top of it and drops it into the off side off the back foot
full outside off, looks for the expansive drive, beaten on pace. Toe-ended to mid-off
good length, angling down leg side, flicked off his pads to fine leg
good length at off stump, comes at him slowly as he defends with hard hands. It lobs up into the off side, safe from all fielders there

dropped. This one is creamed on the up to Shaun Marsh at short extra cover. He gets low to his right quickly and takes it. It pops out of his grasp as his arms hit the floor and he hurriedly tries to pouch it as it bobbles away from him, but can't hold on
good length, angled down leg side
back of a length outside off, steps out and opens the face to run it to third man
back of a length at off stump, looks to push to long-on, gets an inside onto boot, it rolls to the keeper after evading off stump

Marsh holds on this time. Good length, angled in at off stump. Offers the full face as he shapes to hit this over long-on, but the bat turns slightly as he connects. Only height on this, in the end, no distance. Nice and easy at long-on for Marsh
bouncer at middle stump, doesn't quite come on. He is comfortably behind this as he turns it down to fine leg
full at leg stump, flicked nicely to deep square's left
slower ball, misfired. Short and well wide of the marker outside off stump
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
back of a length outside off stump, turned down to third man off the back foot
slower ball, good length at off stump. Looks to flick into the leg side, can only bunt it feebly to midwicket
back of a length outside off stump, nicely on top of the bounce but cuts straight to point
full and angled down leg, flicked off his toes to fine leg
short ball outside off stump, looks to ramp this through the slip region, it's too fast for him. Beaten

short ball outside off stump, this time he keeps the ramp out and looks for a full-blooded club over the off side. Once more, too fast for him, and too steep. It's high up, but barely past the circle and Sandeep takes it at extra cover
and they won't even get close. Good length, slower ball at middle stump. Pokes at this aimlessly with an angled bat. Gets it high, on the sticker, and it lobs up for Mohit to complete a simple catch
back of a length at the thigh, misses out on the glance and gets stuck behind the flap before falling onto the pitch
back of a length at off stump, on top of the bounce and defended into the off side
shot. This is back of a length at off stump, he gives him the charge, makes room and creams this over extra cover
back of a length, in the corridor and moving slightly away as he chops under this and is beaten
good length at off stump, bunted on the up into the off side
back of a length at off stump, he exposes the stumps and makes enough room to slash this past point
good length, angled down the leg side, flicks the pad as it goes through to the keeper
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
back of a length outside off, mistimed back foot punch, straight to point
bouncer outside off is too short, launches upwards after pitching and Amla wants nothing to do with it. Pant has to leap and stretch to hold this
back of a length at off stump, solidly behind it as he pushes it wide of mid-off
follows him down leg side with a good length ball, the flick shot is cut off by Nadeem at square leg who dives to his right
low full toss at off stump, not too much fuss as he brings down the bat and taps it past extra cover
good length at off stump, pushed off the front foot to mid-off
back of a length at off stump, nicely behind this as he defends off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, subdued back foot punch, straight to short extra
back of a length at off stump, whipped to short midwicket off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, punches uppishly but it's on the bounce to short extra cover
back of a length outside off stump, unleashes a wrist cut at this, but Rabada gets down quickly to his left at third man
back of a length at middle stump, gets on his toes and uses his wrists to push this to deep square leg's right
good length at middle stump. This came back in sharply but Amla defended into the off side nicely, with soft hands. Allows Guptill to run through
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler off the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, climbing too, but Guptill arches ever so slightly and ramps this over slip and well fine of third man
back of a length at off stump, drops it into the off side to try and steal a single, connects too well

low full toss at middle stump. He hasn't hit it too well, but there's enough power to clear mid-off comfortably. He looked to lift this over the mid-off boundary but got it off the outside half of the toe-end
good length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
good bouncer outside off, but there's no one deep at square leg. Amla goes for the hook and is hurried on it but it lands safely, halfway between boundary and circle

this has gone several thousand kilometres away! Back of a length at off stump, clears himself for the big swing by backing away and lifts this cleanly, straight and into the second-tier above the bowler
yorker outside off stump, squeezed into the off side
bouncer at off stump, Guptill takes it on and doesn't connect. But this dips quickly and bounces before it reaches Samson at deep square
full on the pads, flicked gracefully and right off the middle, straight to deep square
offcutter, full at leg stump. Picks it and pushes it to mid-on
bouncer pitches on middle stump, deviates down the leg side, just above his blade as he hooks
offcutter, good length at off stump, plays well in front of the body as he looks to drive on the up, chips it in the direction of mid-on
bouncer at middle stump, too early on it again, drags the pull shot down off the under edge, straight to deep square
back of a length at middle stump, backs away and swings across the line. Doesn't connect, but he has done enough to drag this wide of mid-on
back of a length, angled into the pads, stands tall and whips this past short fine
full at leg stump, backs away and pummels a drive to mid-on...where Rabada misfields and gives them fifty for the opening stand
drops it short at middle stump first ball, Guptill goes deep in the crease, swivels, and launches this over the midwicket boundary
good length, googly at the pads. Leans in and turns it behind square on the leg side
back of a length outside off stump, pushed off the back foot to sweeper cover
good length at off stump, beats him in flight. He comes forward and offers the pad
good length at middle stump, gets down for the ramp through fine leg, gets a leading edge that lands just in front of short midwicket
good length at leg stump, hangs deep and slashes across the line to long leg
good length outside off, steps out, not to the pitch, but uses his reach to slap this to sweeper cover
good length, angled down leg side, tickled to long leg off the back foot
tossed up full at middle stump, clears the front leg, clears the midwicket boundary. Old fashioned Guptill slog sweep
good length at off stump, pushed off the front foot to short third man
good length, angled into leg stump, gets low and sweeps it to long leg where Corey Anderson misfields. Guptill brings up his fifty and finishes this game
